pullRequest.body:
This adds some material to `Mathlib.GroupTheory.SpecificGroups.Cyclic` for dealing with groups that have a specified generator, mostly on existence and uniqueness of homomorphisms and isomorphisms in terms of the image of the given generator.


---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

using the following format:

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
I think this should go below `orderOf_eq_card_of_forall_mem_zpowers` (or maybe pull that lemma here)
And maybe other lemmas mentioning `âˆ€ x : Î±, x âˆˆ zpowers a` should be here as well?
OK; moving the lemma up (the other lemma is needed for proofs in between, so cannot be as easily moved).

> And maybe other lemmas mentioning `âˆ€ x : Î±, x âˆˆ zpowers a` should be here as well?

Which place is "here"? The bottom part of the file where I put the new stuff?
Yes. I assume grouping similar lemmas boost visibility? But don't bother if it isn't possible.
And I guess, based on the other lemmas using this condition, I should rename "generates" to "forall_mem_zpowers".
Yeah I think so. Maybe we should define `IsGenerator x := âˆ€ x : Î±, x âˆˆ zpowers a` to enable dot products and better names some time in the future.

> Yes. I assume grouping similar lemmas boost visibility? But don't bother if it isn't possible.

The other lemmas are distrbiuted all over the file, so grouping them would be a fair amount of work, which I think is a bit out of scope for this PR.

> Yeah I think so. Maybe we should define `IsGenerator x := âˆ€ x : Î±, x âˆˆ zpowers a` to enable dot products and better names some time in the future.

It certainly would make sense to either define such a predicate or a `Generator` structure  bundling an element with the predicate (or both?), but this would be a larger refactor of the material and needs more effort to be done right.
Fair enough. This is still a great step forwards nonetheless.
This should be in snake case as this is a def.
Same for the other defs

Lower camel case, you mean? 
```text
  4. All other terms of Types (basically anything else) are in lowerCamelCase.
```
(because it is actually snake case). I'll change that.
Oh yes. Sorry about that.
should this be a simp lemma?

```suggestion
@[to_additive]
lemma mulEquiv_of_orderOf_eq_symm :
    (mulEquiv_of_orderOf_eq hg hg' h).symm = mulEquiv_of_orderOf_eq hg' hg h.symm := rfl
```
should these be simp lemmas?
I can make them (all four you flagged) `simp` lemmas, but I'm doubtful that `simp` will fire often due to the generating conditions.
They are present in the LHS so I believe simp can find it.
I take that back -- the conditions are explicit in the terms...
